definition: to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: Most of the comedians jokes involved a play on words.
sentences.chinese: 喜剧演员的笑话大多是一语双关。

sentences.english: The slogan is a pun on the name of the product.
sentences.chinese: 那广告用语与其产品名称一语双关。

sentences.english: Much British humour depends on ambiguity.
sentences.chinese: 英国幽默有很多是靠一语双关而得。

sentences.english: A pass, the idea of menace finishes now.
sentences.chinese: 一语双关，威胁之意毕现。

sentences.english: Some sort of pun on the word 'tracks' may be intended.
sentences.chinese: 可能作者一语双关，用火车暗指“轨迹”。

definition: pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
